definition: to herd/to breed livestock/to govern (old)/government official (old)

sentences.english: This reminds me of a poem by Du Mu.
sentences.chinese: 這讓我想起了杜牧的一首詩。

sentences.english: Du Mu , the poet in late Tang Dynasty left many poems reflecting women's life and emotions .
sentences.chinese: 晚唐詩人杜牧留下了許多反映女性生活和情感的作品。

sentences.english: Du Mu's mentality is a typical model of the poets' in the late Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 詩人杜牧的心態堪稱晚唐詩人的典型。

sentences.english: Dumu was born in a strongly culture-flavored family which had produced generations of government officials.
sentences.chinese: 杜牧出身於一個世代官宦並具有濃厚文化氣氛的家庭。

sentences.english: The upper distant cold mountain stone footpath is tilted , the white cloud life place has a household.
sentences.chinese: 杜牧的《山行》遠上寒山石徑斜，白雲生處有人家。

sentences.english: Chapter 2 will focus on analyzing the style of Liu Yuxi and Du Mu's poetry.
sentences.chinese: 第二章着重分析劉禹錫和杜牧的詩歌風格。

sentences.english: Du Mu is a famous poet and poser in the late Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 杜牧是晚唐時期著名的詩人與散文家。

sentences.english: The other, Yong Ching Ming poetry very much, Du Mu, "Qingming" the most famous poems.
sentences.chinese: 另，詠清明詩極多，杜牧《清明》詩最爲著名。

sentences.english: The emergence of Dumu's historical discussing poems shows the maturity of historical commenting poems.
sentences.chinese: 杜牧詠史詩的出現，標誌着史論式詠史詩已成熟。

definition: Du Fu (712-770), great Tang dynasty poet

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Cui Hao (-754), Tang dynasty poet and author of poem Yellow Crane Tower 黃鶴樓|黄鹤楼
Meng Jiao (751-814), Tang dynasty essayist and poet
Han Yu (768-824), Tang dynasty essayist and poet, advocate of the classical writing 古文運動|古文运动 and neoclassical 復古|复古 movements
Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian
Lu You (1125-1210), widely regarded as the greatest of the Southern Song poets
Wang Bo (650-676), one of the Four Great Poets of the Early Tang 初唐四傑|初唐四杰[Chu1 Tang2 Si4 jie2]
